Description: North Ionian pottery plate, made up of nine fragments, with two substantial lacunae. Light brown clay with little mica, darker in core; many chalky inclusions. Two suspension holes cut before firing, off centre, on the rim. Sofa rim with slight ridge at turn to floor on the inside. Three sets of grooving on underside. Wear marks on floor. Rim glazed with added white tingues, double-outlined around top. Three bands at edge of floor. On floor, sphinx seated to left on tondo line; in exergue an off-centre floral, with quarter palmette in one corner. Sphinx with face and feet in outline; incision and added red and white in details of hair, wing and breast feathers.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ3
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.547)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (no.723, pl. 99)
